abstract: J Am Chem Soc J Am Chem Soc 319 nihpa Journal of the American Chemical Society 0002-7863 1520-5126 pmc-is-collection-domain yes pmc-collection-title NIHPA Author Manuscripts PMC12490414 PMC12490414.1 12490414 12490414 NIHMS2096311 40629837 10.1021/jacs.5c05269 NIHMS2096311 NIHPA2096311 1 Article Concise Synthesis of Fostriecin and Analogs through Late-Stage Chemoenzymatic Installation of Their Key Pharmacophores Jiang Yanlong † ‡ Yu Xuerong § ‡ Renata Hans § * § † Author Contributions The manuscript was written through contributions of all authors. / All authors have given approval to the final version of the manuscript. ‡ These authors contributed equally. * hrenata@rice.edu 23 7 2025 08 7 2025 147 29 498135 25454 25461 18 07 2025 02 10 2025 03 10 2025 03 10 2025 As one of the most potent and selective protein phosphatase inhibitors, fostriecin shows a broad range of anticancer activity. In light of this property, a phase I clinical trial was conducted on fostriecin, but was soon halted due to issues with compound stability and purity. Numerous efforts in the past two decades have yielded 17 successful syntheses that proceed in 17 to 34 steps.
